title: Ticket #2427: condor_check_userlogs appears to be broken
description:
(Note: this is probably a problem in the underlying log reading code, as opposed to the condor_check_userlogs tool itself. This came up because DAGMan hit a log reading error, and I ran condor_check_userlogs in the course of investigating that.) 

  [wenger@submit 2660]$ condor_check_userlogs wrapup.log
  Error monitoring log file wrapup.log: ReadMultipleUserLogs:9004:Error initializing log file wrapup.log|MultiLogFiles:9001:Error (13, Permission denied) opening file wrapup.log for creation or truncation
  Log outcome: ULOG_NO_EVENT
  08/26/11 16:39:59 ReadMultipleUserLogs error: Didn't find LogFileMonitor object for log file wrapup.log (2113:8592006)!
  08/26/11 16:39:59 All log monitors:
Error unmonitoring log file wrapup.log: ReadMultipleUserLogs:9004:Didn't find LogFileMonitor object for log file wrapup.log (2113:8592006)!
  Log(s) have error(s)

When I ran the 7.6.3 condor_check_userlogs on that same log file, everything was fine.
remarks:
2011-Aug-26 16:58:32 by wenger:
Okay, it looks like this is something funky about file permissions -- it looks like maybe the log file reading code can only open the file if you are the owner of it. Here are the permissions on that log file: 

  -rw-r--r--  1 bt bt 637 Aug 26 14:27 wrapup.log

condor_check_userlogs fails on that (even though I can look at the file with any other tool).

If I just copy the file (in the same directory) I get this: 

  -rw-r--r--  1 wenger wenger 637 Aug 26 16:55 wrapup.log.kent

condor_check_userlogs works fine on that one: 

  [wenger@submit 2660]$ condor_check_userlogs wrapup.log.kent
  Log event: ULOG_SUBMIT (3807014.0.0) ("DAG Node: wrapup")
   Total submitted: 1; net submitted: 1


  Log event: ULOG_EXECUTE (3807014.0.0)
  Log event: ULOG_JOB_TERMINATED (3807014.0.0)
   Total submitted: 1; net submitted: 0


  Log outcome: ULOG_NO_EVENT
  Log(s) are okay

2011-Aug-26 17:02:11 by wenger:
Oops, the problem isn't ownership, per se, it's that you have to have write permission on a log file to read it: 

  [wenger@submit 2660]$ chmod 444 wrapup.log.kent
  [wenger@submit 2660]$ condor_check_userlogs !$
  condor_check_userlogs wrapup.log.kent
  Error monitoring log file wrapup.log.kent: ReadMultipleUserLogs:9004:Error initializing log file wrapup.log.kent|MultiLogFiles:9001:Error (13, Permission denied) opening file wrapup.log.kent for creation or truncation
  Log outcome: ULOG_NO_EVENT
  08/26/11 17:00:19 ReadMultipleUserLogs error: Didn't find LogFileMonitor object for log file wrapup.log.kent (2113:8593701)!
  08/26/11 17:00:19 All log monitors:
  Error unmonitoring log file wrapup.log.kent: ReadMultipleUserLogs:9004:Didn't find LogFileMonitor object for log file wrapup.log.kent (2113:8593701)!
  Log(s) have error(s)

Okay, I just tried the 7.6.3 condor_check_userlogs on a file I can't write, and I got the same error, so I guess this is nothing new...

2011-Aug-28 09:11:21 by matt:
See #1745 and consider eliminating the write permission requirement.
creator: wenger
